title: Human Resources Executive
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Here at THE PROVIDORE SINGAPORE we frankly believe that we are stronger as a team!
TEAMWORK MAKES THE DREAM WORK!

We take pride in having an environment that is open and welcoming, to achieve our goals together. With an emphasis on communication and connection, we promote opportunities for all to develop and achieve success; our employees are our family, and we strive to create an inclusive and positive culture for all!

Across our various roles and departments, we have a diverse workforce that is built on the strengths of each and every individual. Our ethos is to create an environment where our people matter, and a place where we celebrate each other's success.

If being part of a fun, dynamic team that works hard yet plays harder is something you are looking for, what are you waiting for? You might just be the next celebrated member of our team!

Visit https://theprovidore.com/careers/ for more opportunities and to apply directly!


HIRING FOR:
HUMAN RESOURCES (HR) EXECUTIVE
THE PROVIDORE SINGAPORE
HR has to offer more than just the traditional administrative practice, theology and mindset; it must be able to provide value-add to an organization through analytical insight and information for betterment of the overall HR experience:
Increase productivity
Reduce wastage costs
Provide direction for improved solutions
Support business growth with information, automation and technology
Accountability and Growth are key attributes of not only the team, but in the embedded culture of the Company as a whole.


Job Description:

Reporting directly to the Group HR Director, and working closely with key stakeholders, you will play a critical role in the HR Transformation process of driving innovation and improvement for continued empowerment and support to safeguarding our most valuable asset - Our people.

Primary Focus Areas:
Payroll
Compensation & Benefits
Total Rewards
HR Reports
Secondary Support:
Employee Life Cycle
Recruitment & Talent Acquisition
Employee Engagement
Performance Management
Any other HR Functional Area or Skill-Development Tasks as assigned by the Group HR Director
*Full Job Description will be shared and discussed further with shortlisted candidates


Job Requirements:
Degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Statistics, Business Administration or Finance from a recognized institution
An analytical and inquisitive mindset is critical; keen to explore and challenge the norms of HR
Able to cohesively work in in a strong, team environment as well as build, and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Direct, related experience Payroll, Compensation & Benefits, and Total Rewards will be highly advantageous
Knowledge and experience is HR & Payroll Systems will be good to have
Genuinely high levels of attention to detail, with meticulous accuracy in analytics, calculations, figures and presentation
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Knowledge in Employment Act, IRAS, MOM, and Statutory Regulations

We look forward to receiving your application, and the opportunity to meet you!

title: HR Executive
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
CYS Global Remit is on the lookout for a highly effective HR Executive. If you enjoy a fast paced environment, communicating and care greatly for others, we want you on our team!

In this role, you will get to:
• Screen candidates for interviews and assist in the recruitment process
• Provide administration and HR support to fellow colleagues
• Learn how to manage leave records
• Ensure and enforce colleagues’ adherence to HR policies and procedures
• Organise and participate in company events
• Liaise with external service providers
• Designing programs to reduce turnover, boost morale, and employee loyalty
• Perform any other duties as assigned

What we are looking for in you:
• Minimum Diploma in any field. (Candidates specialising in HR will have an advantage)
• A team player with excellent interpersonal and organisational skills
• Effective oral and written communication skills
• Ability to multitask and enjoy challenges
• Able to exhibit a high level of confidentiality with a keen sense of ethics
• Proficient in Microsoft Office
• General knowledge of various employment laws and practices will be a plus
• Able to start immediately or within a short notice will be a plus

title: HR Executive
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and organized individual to join our HR team as a Senior HR Executive / Assistant Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the full spectrum of HR functions, including recruitment and selection, processing of employment letters, work pass applications, payroll, employee benefits and compensation, training, and performance management.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist in the management of the full spectrum of HR functions
Assist in the recruitment and selection process
Process employment letters, work pass applications, renewals, and cancellations
Update and maintain job descriptions and requirements
Manage attendance records, monthly payroll, and payroll reports
Ensure timely submission of CPF and income tax to relevant government entities
Manage employee welfare activities and benefits
Maintain and update the company's HR handbook, policies, and procedures
Prepare disciplinary letters and staff memos/announcements
Arrange employee relations, bonding, and communication activities (e.g. birthdays, D&D, meet-up sessions)
Prepare training materials and conduct organization-wide training based on retail and business needs
Evaluate and audit the quality of training programs and plan improvements
Implement training and development tools and concepts
Conduct new employee induction program
Assist in the management of performance management exercises for confirmation, renewal, and annual performance review
Support senior management in annual budgeting exercises
Collaborate with government agencies for grants and other HR-related projects
Manage organization chart and contact list changes
Respond to employee inquiries
Perform other duties as assigned

Job Requirements:
Diploma / Degree in Human Resources or related discipline
1 year of experience in the related field (fresh graduates are welcome to apply)
Bilingual in English and Mandarin
Meticulous attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Work Location: 37 Kaki Bukit View
Candidates with more experience will be considered for the Assistant HR Manager position. If you meet the requirements and are interested in this opportunity, please send your updated resume in MS Word format. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Senior HR Executive
company: WORLD SCIENTIFIC PUBLISHING CO PTE LTD
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
World Scientific is looking for a dynamic individual who is passionate about helping people learn and grow. This Senior HR Executive is to focus on people development by establishing, implementing training and development programmes to facilitate employees' growth and capability building.

Responsibilities
Analyse capability and performance gaps within organisation to identify learning needs.
Plan, develop, implement and administer learning strategies and programs for employees.
Assess course contents prepared by vendors.
Periodical review to address gaps; motivate and support staff to achieve targets.
Monitor, administer and evaluate program effectiveness through surveys and feedback.
Propose, track records of training expenses.
To support other HR functions as required.
Requirements
Diploma holder, minimum 2 years working experience related to training.
Ability to evaluate, research and propose training options.
Proficient in MS Office
Strong presentation and facilitation skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Must be self-motivated, proactive, meticulous, resourceful, creative, with good working attitude.
Ability to work independently and as a team player in a dynamic, international environment.
Bilingual with strong command of English and Chinese to be able to liaise with Chinese speaking counterparts.

title: HR Executive - Staffing BU
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
**Please note this job posting is under WSG Career Trial Programme**

We are urgently looking for personnel to fill the role of HR Executive (Staffing BU).
Location: Tampines, Singapore
Your function will include among others the following activities:
Talent acquisition
Identifying skilled talents from company database for our jobs across Singapore, Rest of APAC & MENA
Creating, Posting & Managing Job Posts on Linkedin, mycareersfuture etc.
Processing of applications (phone calls, meetings with candidates…)
Liaise & coordinate interviews with Clients
Prepare and submit weekly reports to Management.
Client Relationship Management: Manage and retain relationships with existing Clients
Act as Point of contact with contract staff & other stakeholders for insurance, salary, payslip, expense claim, bank details, social contributions, immigrations, timesheets, etc.
Manage immigration procedures for Expatriates through local partners & related stakeholders
Manage profile creation, onboarding, etc. on company's HRMS platform
Send monthly reports to the Admin and Accounts depts.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
📧 EMAIL ID : Interested candidates, please email your resume to mike.ramos@nttdata.com

Medical Insurance Coverage
Leave credits
Performance Bonus

Responsibilities:
Ensure that licensed representatives fulfill all regulated requirements prior to lodgement of licensed activities with the regulator, including the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Singapore Exchange Ltd.
Lodge licensed representatives for the activities required for the appointed role, in compliance with regulatory requirements.
Cease or add activities of licensed representatives due to change in role or resignation.
Submit updates from licensed representatives on changes in personal details to the Monetary Authority of Singapore in accordance with regulatory requirements.
Review processes performed by the team to ensure they are up to date with the latest regulatory requirements.
Design and maintain the workflow representation of all Standard Operating Processes performed by the team.
Work with the HRSS-Information Services team to ensure that processes are automated and moved to the digital platform wherever possible, which includes providing specifications and conducting User Acceptance Testing of systems prior to “live” implementation.
Process the payment of fees due to the regulators, including the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Singapore Exchange Ltd.
Liaise with licensed representatives and HR teams, including Business HR, HRSS-Employee Life Cycle, HRSS-Records Management, HRSS-Information Services, HR-Talent Acquisition Group and HR-Learning & Development, to ensure that updates on licensed representatives to the regulators are completed on a timely basis.



About us:

NTT DATA, a global leader in digital business and IT services, offers a thriving environment for career growth and excellence. Recognized as a "Top Employer 2023" in multiple countries, NTT DATA's commitment to talent acquisition, values, and ethics creates an outstanding workplace. With a diverse community of over 140,000 innovators worldwide, competitive benefits, and a focus on innovation,

NTT DATA empowers employees to drive transformation in cloud, data, and applications. title: SK12791888 HR Executive (6 months contract to permanent)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Our client, a high-end fashion brand, is currently looking for a HR executive to support them on the full spectrum of HR operations tasks. This role is for a period of 6 months and has potential to be converted to a permanent staff.
The Role
Responsibilities include assisting the HR Director on the day to day HR operations scope such as end to end recruitment cycle, onboarding, HRIS and database management, implementing training programs, liaison with training team on training materials, setting up of equipment, program coordination, etc.
Your Profile
You should have a minimum diploma in business or human resources or its equivalent and bring along with you at least 3 to 5 years of relevant experience. You are well versed with he employment act and are a self stater and problem solver. Prior knowledge in Workday would be advantageous. Immediate availability is preferred.

title: 3487 - HR Executive [ Recruitment / Training / Development / Jurong East / up to $3,500 ]
company: THE SUPREME HR ADVISORY PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
HR Executive (Recruitment /Training & Development / Engagement team)
Basic Salary: $3000 - $3500 (Company provide AWS & Performance Bonus)
Working days: Monday - Friday (8am - 5:45pm)
Location: Jurong East

Reporting to the Senior HR Manager, employee is responsible for the full recruitment & selection process, whole onboarding facilitation, training & development, communication, sand employee relations.
Responsibilities:

Recruitment
Perform full recruitment cycle from sourcing, screening, interviewing and recommendation to successful placements.
Liaise and work with all hiring managers & HR team, to ensure all critical positions are filled with competent candidates within targeted lead-time
Identify and manage all relevant recruitment sources & platform so as to reach out to the right candidates on a timely basis
Manage employee referral program planning and implementation
Conducting interviews and make recommendations on selection.
Administer the whole on boarding process including preparation of contracts, conduct structured orientation program to brief new hires on board.
Ensure compliance and adherence process e.g. on boarding checklist.
Prepare and update headcount report, turnover report, recruitment report, organisation charts, employee profile.
Analyse and compile reports on current organizational trends such as manpower, employee turnover, employee satisfaction recruitment and absenteeism.
Liaison with Government/Stat Boards on related HR Matters
Handling all work pass related issues such as application, renewal, cancellation and appeals.
Submit MOM questionnaires and surveys, whenever required.
Employee Relations/ Engagement/ communication
Conduct Monthly employee discussion & New Join experience.
Handle Quarterly newsletters content and publishing.
Assist with employee’s enquiries.
Employees engagement & performance projects.
Liaise with MHC to create MHC account for new join staff.
Training & Development (Supporting role when needed)
Review staff training needs and manage learning calendar for employees
Promote training programs to HODs to inculcate a learning culture among staff.
Monitor and report programme outcomes and results that include tracking of training records, costs, effectiveness, training evaluation and feedback.
Source for and liaise with training providers and coordinators,
Register employee to training courses and to apply government grants.
Administer training records, documentation and government grants.
Ad-Hoc Duties
Support with onboarding orientation for new joiners.
Support in HR projects, whenever necessary.
Any other HR matters whenever directed by Manager/Managing Director /Management
Requirements:
Degree or Diploma in HRM or equivalent, with at least 2-3 years of relevant working experience.
Good knowledge and application of MOM Employment Act & Policies
Hands on experience with payroll system will be an added advantage

title: Senior HR Executives
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Public Listed Healthcare Organisation
People Centric Culture
Be part of a vibrant and collaborative team
Job Description
The Opportunity
This is an exciting role for an enthusiastic professional to be a part of a people focused and collaborative HR team and a key contributor within our HR Shared Services function. If you are looking to gain invaluable experience to advance your career by contributing to the development of a progressive and forward thinking HR function, we would love to hear from you.

How you will make an impact
You will be responsible for end-to-end payroll and employee life cycle activities, providing a broad spectrum of payroll and employee services that support the day-to-day execution and delivery of HR operations activities for the assigned business areas.
You will also actively support other aspects of the HR shared services and operations and participates in recruitment, HR projects and initiatives.

Requirements
Demonstrated experience and proficiency in a high volume, multi payroll cycle environment.
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to details, strong analytical and excel skill.
Excellent written and communication skills.
To know more about Alliance Healthcare Group, visit us at www.alliancehealthcare.com.sg
